Context:
Program Name: Video Design & Production
Code: P112
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $5,034.00
International Tuition: $17,930.00
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Media & Performing Arts
Location: St. James Campus
Program Overview: The Video Design & Production program prepares students with the knowledge and practical skills required in this emerging field by merging traditional filmmaking techniques with new mediums and distributive methodologies. Graduates will be equipped with entrepreneurial knowledge and skills to decide which path is best for them. Students will be exposed to video design and production including mobile technology, virtual production, and post-production skills to create video for entertainment, marketing, advertising, education, and social network strategies.
Program Description: Ranked as one of the best film schools in Canada, George Brown College’s Video Design & Production diploma program will expose students to traditional and emerging filmic techniques.
Credential Types: Ontario College Diploma
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Tuition Fees:
- Domestic Students: $5,034.00
- International Students: $17,930.00
Program Availability:
- Fall 2023: Closed for both domestic and international students
- Winter 2024: Closed for both domestic and international students
- Spring 2024: Not Available for both domestic and international students
Related Programs: Media Foundation (P111), Graphic Design (G102), Art and Design Foundation (G108)

Context:
The Video Design & Production program at the college requires students to have a personal computer with the following minimum specifications:
- laptop or desktop
- CPU: 8th-generation Intel Core i5 – i7
- graphics: Intel UHD graphics 620 or equivalent
- RAM: 4GB – 16GB (recommended)
- screen: 13.3-inch – 15 inch
- storage: 500GB – 1TB SSD, additional storage: 2-4TB Portable HD (optional but recommended)
- optional: 4K Capable Mirrorless or Digital SLR

Graduates of this program may be interested in the Screenwriting & Narrative Design graduate certificate program.

The required courses for Semester 1 are:
- VDES 1001: Digital Storytelling I (no pre-requisite)
- VDES 1002: Video Design and Composition (no pre-requisite)
- VDES 1003: Digital Video Technology (no pre-requisite)
- VDES 1004: Digital Production I (no pre-requisite)
- VDES 1000: Mise-en-Scène & Film Structures (no pre-requisite)
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts (no pre-requisite)

Video designers may move across multiple platforms including film, television and interaction storytelling. Potential job titles include filmmaker, screenwriter, director, assistant director, editor, editorial assistant, producer, production manager, production assistant.

The media industry in Toronto and Ontario is experiencing strong projected growth with Canadians watching more online video than nearly anyone else in the world. Job titles related to this industry may include filmmaker, screenwriter, director, assistant director, editor, editorial assistant, producer, production manager, production assistant.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Video Design & Production Program P112 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Semester 3:
- Digital Storytelling II (VDES 1001)
- Digital Production II (VDES 1004)
- Digital Cinematography I (VDES 1015)
- Capstone Preparation (VDES 2004)
- Digital Cinematography II (VDES 2005)
- Audio Production Post I (VDES 1002, VDES 1003)
- Scriptwriting (VDES 1011)
- Directing (VDES 1015, VDES 1014)
- General Education Elective (GNED)

Semester 4:
- Capstone Project
- Capstone Project prerequisite: successful completion of all semester 3 courses
- Production Entrepreneurship (VDES 2014)
- XR Production (VDES 2016)
- Art Direction (VDES 2009)
- General Education Elective (GNED)

Courses:
- COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication, may be required before progressing to COMM 2000)

Learning Outcomes:
- Create independent digital film projects according to project specifications using various production techniques.
- Work effectively as a member of a digital film production team in various capacities and roles.
- Manage scheduling and budget for digital film productions.
- Capture quality moving images using appropriate camera/lighting equipment and techniques.
- Develop a short film and television portfolio to showcase digital filmmaking skills.
- Write story-driven, visual and cinematic scripts focused on effective dialogue, structure and character development.
- Record and mix multi-track sound in a digital format using industry standard equipment and software.
- Market and distribute digital film projects using industry and new media outlets.
- Edit digital video on nonlinear, industry standard software and equipment.

Program Learning Outcomes (General):
- Create independent digital film projects according to project specifications using various production techniques.
- Work effectively as a member of a digital film production team in various capacities and roles.
- Manage scheduling and budget for digital film productions.
- Capture quality moving images using appropriate camera/lighting equipment and techniques.
- Develop a short film and television portfolio to showcase digital filmmaking skills.
- Write story-driven, visual and cinematic scripts focused on effective dialogue, structure and character development.
- Record and mix multi-track sound in a digital format using industry standard equipment and software.
- Market and distribute digital film projects using industry and new media outlets.
- Edit digital video on nonlinear, industry standard software and equipment.

Context:
Domestic Tuition: $5,034.00 for programs starting in Fall 2022
International Tuition: $17,930.00 for programs starting in Fall 2023
Additional Costs (total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees):
- For domestic students: $5,034.00 for first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022
- For international students: $17,930.00 for first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023
Note: Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates.
Financial Assistance: The program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria.
Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- Grade 12 English (C or U)
- Portfolio (demo reel)
- Current resume
- Video submission
- Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English or consider upgrading to achieve required credits in English.
Note: Students starting program in January (winter term) will be required to attend classes during summer months (May to August).
Course exemptions: College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions. Visit the Transfer Guide for more information.
International students: Visit the International Admissions page for more information regarding country-specific admission requirements.
How to Apply: Not specified in the text.

Context:
Program Offered: The program is offered through the School of Media and Performing Arts.

Application Process for Domestic Students: Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.

Application Process for International Students: International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.

Contact Information for School of Media & Performing Arts: Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 2015; Email: media@georgebrown.ca

Campus Location and Programs Offered at St. James Campus: The program classes take place at the St. James Campus located at 230 Richmond Street East, Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Related programs include Media Foundation (P111), Graphic Design (G102), and Art and Design Foundation (G108).

Contact Information for International Students: Contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry through the International Contact Us page.

On-campus information sessions and campus tours are available to learn about program content, career options, meet professors and staff, and experience George Brown College classrooms. Sign up for an information session or book a campus tour.

Additional Resources: Sign up to receive tailored resources to make your application process easier.
